title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer takes title dig at Liverpool ahead of Premier League showdown
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has mocked Liverpool’s 30-year wait to win the Premier League title on the eve of Sunday’s grudge match at Old Trafford.

Manchester United will host the current table toppers in a precarious position, just a solitary point above the relegation zone after their worst ever start to a season.

Liverpool, my marked contrast, currently top the table by five points and are in the midst of a winning streak that will extend to 18 top flight matches should inflict a further blow on a beleaguered Solskjaer.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Jurgen Klopp ended Liverpool’s trophy drought in spectacular fashion back in June by guiding his team to a sixth Champions League crown, but the trophy the Anfield faithful really crave is the Premier League title.

Liverpool last enjoyed domestic dominance back in 1990, before the formation of the Premier League and, despite their current malaise, Solskjaer cannot imagine his club ever having to wait that long to be regarded as the best team in England.

He said: ‘I am sure we will bounce back and win the league. And I am sure it won’t be 30 years until the next Premier League that we do win.’

United have won just one of their last seven Premier League games and are struggling for goals but Solskjaer is hopeful a victory over the old enemy could spark their season back into life.

He added: ‘A good performance and result for us here can turn a season.

‘It can change players’ confidence, players’ mood, their perception of what is good.

‘Maybe they haven’t really believed they are good enough at times. With a lack of confidence, you think twice instead of acting on instinct.

‘But I know these players are good enough – no worries about that.’
